pros: Most of the people are great!
cons: Major burnout from covid and low staffing.

review_title: Normal company to work for. Nothing exceptional, nothing miserable.
job_title: Cyber Security Analyst in Manchester, NH
pros: Good management, good work life balance, easy to get time off
cons: Healthcare can be challenging to work in.

review_title: Pretty good work-life balance, No promotions
pros: The organization does good work, and has many good people working there. We have pretty good PTO, especially after you hit 5 years.
cons: No promotions. There’s literally no system to promote people. Raises have not kept pace with inflation. New employees are paid more than senior ones. There has been night turn over recently.

review_title: Lots of turnover, but not horrible
pros: Amazing coworkers, generally flexible about scheduling/days off, day goes by quickly.
cons: A bit of micromanaging, job is somewhat difficult/thankless at times, lots of people who have been there for a while and have dug their heels and aren't flexible.

pros: Great experience in the ER side of registration
cons: Supervisors weren't lenient in hard times

pros: Several workers are hardworking, compassionate, and conscientious
cons: Management possesses undesirable leadership traits that cause friction between employees. There is a lack of support, and extreme favoritism, in a toxic environment.

review_title: Great lower level management, poor pay/benefits
job_title: Practice support services in Nashua, NH
pros: The lower level management is fantastic. They really seem to care about their employees
cons: The pay is very low and then health insurance is expensive for what you get. The family deductible is 5k, which is a lot considering how low the salary is. This deductible is also only if you stay within the tier 1 network, which is basically only solution health. Our of network deductible is anywhere from 7k-10k depending on where you go. There is also very little flexibility with schedules and no room for employment growth and development despite what they tell you.

job_title: Health Information Specialist in Nashua, NH
pros: Good raises annually based on performance, better benefits now merged with Elliot. Remote opportunities or hybrid has remained since COVID.
cons: Snhmc got swallowed up by Elliot and SolutionHealth rebrand and marketing and messaging was and still is confusing to patients
poor management and leadership AND NO STRATEGY

review_title: Hopefully going to recover from Covid churn soon
job_title: Epic Applications Analyst II in Manchester, NH
pros: Good, solid teams, lots of experience and institutional knowledge. Decent pay and benefits. Organization serves its community and the people who need it.
cons: Large amounts of leadership turnover, dis-empowered management, no path forward, lack of governance structure.

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Nashua, NH
cons: Can be busy and a bit overwhelming

pros: Benefits, employee cafe discount, some co workers are nice
